remarks: A bijection of the base sets induces a bijection on the set of finitely supported functions.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2015.) Obsolete version of ~ mapfien as of 3-Jul-2019. (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
mapfienOLD.s $e |- S = { x e. ( B ^m A ) | ( `' x " ( _V \ { Z } ) ) e. Fin } $.
mapfienOLD.t $e |- T = { x e. ( D ^m C ) | ( `' x " ( _V \ { W } ) ) e. Fin } $.
mapfienOLD.w $e |- W = ( G ` Z ) $.
mapfienOLD.f $e |- ( ph -> F : C -1-1-onto-> A ) $.
mapfienOLD.g $e |- ( ph -> G : B -1-1-onto-> D ) $.
mapfienOLD.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. _V ) $.
mapfienOLD.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. _V ) $.
mapfienOLD.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. _V ) $.
mapfienOLD.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. _V ) $.
mapfienOLD.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. B ) $.
mapfienOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( f e. S |-> ( G o. ( f o. F ) ) ) : S -1-1-onto-> T ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
$d D x $.
$d F f x $.
$d G f x $.
$d S f $.
$d T f $.
$d W x $.
